fractions.prompt: In a monitoring dashboard, 3/10 of alerts are CPU-related and 1/5 are memory-related. What fraction of alerts are CPU or memory? (simplify)
A service used 7/8 of its error budget, then saved back 1/4 of a budget by improvements. What fraction of the budget is still used? (simplify)
An SRE team spent 2/3 of their on-call time on incidents and 1/6 on documentation. What fraction of time was spent on these two? (simplify)
A log pipeline drops 1/12 of events due to noise filters, then drops another 1/8 due to rate limits. What fraction is dropped in total? (simplify)
A release window is 3/4 hour. If a deploy takes 1/6 hour, how much time is left? (simplify)
A dashboard shows 5/6 uptime so far. After a short outage, uptime drops by 1/15. What is the new uptime fraction? (simplify)
Write a fraction equivalent to 3/5 with denominator 20 (format like 12/20).
Write a fraction equivalent to 7/8 with denominator 32 (format like 28/32).
Is 2/3 equal to 8/12? Answer yes or no.

negatives.prompt: A server room is at -2 degrees C. Overnight it drops by 7 degrees C. What is the new temperature?
Your monitoring dashboard shows an error rate change of -12. Then it changes by +5. What is the total change?
A log counter goes from 15 to -6 (a drop). What is the change? (final - start)
An incident queue had -3 backlog (ahead). Then 9 incidents arrived. What is the new backlog?
A metric is at -10. After a fix, it increases by 4, then decreases by 9. What is the final value?
A battery level is at 6. It drains by 11. What is the new level?

linear-equations.prompt: An on-call engineer earns a $20 base bonus plus $5 per incident. Total bonus was $45. How many incidents? (x)
A monitoring tool costs $12 per month plus a one-time $8 setup fee. This month you paid $44. How many months (x) were billed?
A data pipeline processes x events per minute. In 6 minutes it processes 90 events. What is x?
A team fixed 4 bugs per day for x days and fixed 52 bugs total. How many days?
A service has x servers. If you add 7 more, you have 23. What is x?
A latency target is 80 ms. Current latency is x, and after reducing by 15 ms you hit the target: x - 15 = 80. What is x?

mixed-review.prompt: [Fractions] A log pipeline drops 1/12 of events due to noise filters, then drops another 1/8 due to rate limits. What fraction is dropped in total? (simplify)
